list.title: Available parsers
list.bullet: *Event-driven* (one tag at time) parsers, e.g. expat. These are good for big XML document and you can filter the input, but needs more code and parser state handling.

Parse everything to a DOM XML tree, e.g. Gnome's libxml. All the parsing is done for you, but it can be slower for big files. It also uses more memory and the tag filtering needs to be done post-facto.
Parse-on-demand parsers (aka "pull parsers"), that internally behave like the event-driven ones, but return a branch of the DOM tree _for the node (or nodes) requested_.
